snippet: It is time to create new social science departments that reflect the breadth and complexity of the problems we face as well as the novelty of 21st-century science.
abstract: Gray Matter column by sociologist and physician Nicholas A Christakis contends social sciences, in contrast to physical and biological sciences, have stagnated, offering essentially the same set of academic departments and disciplines that they have for nearly 100 years; calls for creation of new social science departments that reflect the breath and complexity of the problems humanity faces as well as the novelty of 21st-century science.
lead_paragraph: It is time to create new social science departments that reflect the breadth and complexity of the problems we face as well as the novelty of 21st-century science.

headline.print_headline: Let’s Shake Up The Social Sciences
headline.main: Let’s Shake Up the Social Sciences
